snippet: Mitt Romney is keeping his focus on President Obama, but his aides say they are keeping a close watch on his Republican rivals and Newt Gingrich.
abstract: Mitt Romney is pursuing a new campaign strategy of focusing on Pres Obama and the general election while seeming to downplay Newt Gingrich, Romney's closest rival for the Republican nomination; Romney aides contend that engaging Gingrich too directly will only draw attention to his insurgent candidacy.

byline.contributor: Brian Knowlton contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is keeping his focus on President Obama, but his aides say they are keeping a close watch on his Republican rivals and Newt Gingrich.

headline.seo: Gingrich, After Nevada Loss, Says He Will Keep Fighting
headline.main: Romney Hopes to Thwart Gingrich Without Focusing on Him
headline.print_headline: Romney Campaign Is Hoping to Thwart Gingrich Without Focusing on Him
